oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Handbook for U. S. forces in Vietnam
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Department of Defense pamphlet published for soldiers in combat in Vietnam. It provides text, illustrations, maps, and photographs. There are four chapters in the document, along with an appendix providing personal hygiene tips, a table, conversion and a road map of Vietnam. It contains military government document series codes at the top of the front cover.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Combat support; Tactics; Combat -- Handbooks, manuals, etc.; United States -- Armed Forces -- Handbooks, manuals, etc.; Vietnam War, 1961-1975; Guerrilla warfare -- Handbooks, manuals, etc.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States. Dept. of Defense. Armed Forces Information and Education Division
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In an effort to provide increased effectiveness for U. S. armed forces in Vietnam, this handbook furnished information to soldiers about the Republic of Vietnam, the Viet-Cong, tactics and techniques, and combat support. This information was compiled from the experiences of those engaged in previous combat operations against the enemy.
